content: Edited "There will be r rounds..." to accurately match the order of attack (its now b hits a first then a hits b instead of vice versa). Also added that in case of a tie b is the winner.

This clash is a bit confusing because of the hit order.

One of the first lines says "There will be r rounds, each round **a will hit b** and decrease his health by a_1, b hits a and decreases his health by b_1", which makes it seem like a will hit b first. But then you later clarify that b actually hits first in the note at the bottom. This confused me in my clash and I was stuck for a bit trying to understand why, since in Fastest mode you often skim over longer statements to save time. It might be good to change that first line around to avoid the misleading implication.

Also, your code favours "B" as the winner in the case of a tie. You specify that there is always a winner, but "Test 3" is actually a tie with both on 256 health at the end.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple puzzle easy to solve, can be interesting/fun to play on "shortest code" or "quickest"

Based on your third note "Player B or Player A's health can be more than their initial values after the r rounds." and in the constraints you have mentioned that: "30 <= a b <= 500" which means that a player health can't exceed 500 however in your second test "Output B 510" I see this as contradicting you should adjust the values of the test case to ensure that your are within your suggested constraints

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Too complicated statement

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: it's simple to understood.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I think it sounds interesting

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Confusing statement:

contradiction= "each round a will hit b" in 2nd sentence contradicts "b will hit a first" in 6th sentence

not clear="and also this is confirmed that any of them will be the winner in the end." 

not clear = what happens with health recovery in case of death. "If any of the player's health get below 0 or equal to 0, the fight ends" contradicts comment that says that health recovery takes place

We already have a few "a hits b, b hits a, who wins?" Clashes, but this one feels very, very generic, nothing really new, nor challenging. 

We start with a title (with both names I assume?), 1 line of lore, and then a super generic statement. Why not keep the story until the end, and use iornicHealth, iornicAttack, titanicHealth and titanicAttack? because "a b a_1 and b_1" are a bit... lazy in my opinion hahah You can also keep the story going with something like "They both have a life-stealing weapon that recovers half the damage dealt (rounded down) to them", instead of what feels like "use this formula on that variable".

Also, I think it would add a small layer, if the recovered health was based on the actual damage dealt, instead of just half the attack. So in a case where B have 20 hp left, and A have an attack of 60, the hit is only making 20 damage, so only 10 hp is recovered on A (instead of 30).
You should change the order at the second line to match the intended order where b hits a first, it might bring confusion at first, and I was until I read the second note.
Problem statement is defined well, i can understand easily.

Goal section
* "they" will get health - it is not clear what "they" refer to. Suggest to use "the attacker" instead.
* a_1 / 2 or b_1 / 2: Please specify that the health to add is the rounded down value.
* Why doesn't the game end when any fighter's health drops to 0 or below?

Output section
* Please format A and B by as constants by replacing "A" with {{A}} and "B" with {{B}}. The quotation marks can then be removed.
* Is the note important, or can it be deleted?

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Thanks.

Thank your for your review

The game will not end bcuz the fighter's health will never be less than 0 or equal to 0.

The note is important, so that the coc player may not be confused that if fighter's health can be more than 500 or not
:thumbsup: cool
fixed it :thumbsup:
nope, player's health can get below 0 and after he dies , he drops some health (damage/2), which player A gets, and also I don't want to keep the variable name long that's why I used [[a]] and [[b]]

1. A fighter's health can drop below 0. I used your code on Test 2 and got the following intermediate health values of A and B:
195 420
140 440
85 460
30 480
-25 500
-80 520
-135 540
-190 560
-245 580

2. The note confuses me more than not. I think it is clearer to just say a fighter's health can increase beyond its initial value.

3. The note in point 2 above should be moved to the Goal section.

4. In the Output section please specify that the winner and the remaining health value is separated by a space.

Thanks.
kk
fixed them

OK.

Goal section
* Please replace "500" with "their initial values"
* Please add "the fight ends," after "equal to 0".

Output section
* Please specify that the winner and the remaining health value is separated by a space.

Thanks.
Done :thumbsup:

Goal section
* Please change "it's" to "his" in the last sentence.

Thanks.

Come on it's not a english or grammer challange, almost everyone can understand that much, and you know what in science we ignore that silly grammer mistakes.

I mean just appriciate him.
Thank you for your reminder. I am sorry if I leave you with the impression that I am some kind of grammar policeman. I never intend to be one, nor to catch every single mistake.
No Problem :)
